name: Bam-Bam Cam
description:
In the 1993–94 season Cam Neely scored his 50th goal in his 44th game! Only Wayne Gretzky has scored 50 goals in fewer games. 

Neely was as devastating with his body checks and fists as he was with his goal scoring exploits. He became the archetype of the ultimate power forward and earned the nickname 'Bam-Bam Cam'.

In other words he's an absolute Boston Legend!

Shirt is a poly/cotton/rayon blend which equates to SUPREME softness! Lightweight, stylish, comfortable, dynamite.

name: FEAR THE BEARD
description:
The perfect metaphor for the 2013 Red Sox is staring us right in the face.

You’ll just have to trust that there’s actually a face under there, because nothing symbolizes this group of veteran overachievers better than the thickets where their cheeks, chins and necks used to be.

If 2003 gave us “Cowboy Up” and 2004 the “Idiots,” then 2013 has taught the rest of baseball to “Fear the Beard.”
Like the hair on their faces, the Red Sox have grown stronger, closer, and more remarkable by the day. That they’ve rallied around their beards perfectly suits their identity as a team full of veteran grinders who play — and win — without a hint of vanity.

“It fits us because we’re representing a blue collar approach,” catcher Jarrod Saltalamacchia said. “We’re a bunch of guys who go to work and do the best we can. We’re not clean shaven and we want to get our hands dirty.”
 
-John Tomase of the Boston Herald

It's playoff time baby! Get Grizzly,Go Sox, Fear the Beard! 

50% cotton / 50% poly = supersoft as always.

All Fear The Beard's ship Oct. 2nd

name: Terriers Hockey - Red
description:
The Boston University Terriers men’s ice hockey program is one of the most storied teams in NCAA Division I hockey, playing its first ever game in 1918[2] and winning five national championships, while making twenty-one appearances in the Frozen Four.

BU has won twelve major conference tournament championships as well as 29 titles in the historic Beanpot tournament featuring the four major Boston collegiate hockey teams. 

BU played in the Eastern College Athletic Conference (ECAC) from 1961 to 1984, winning five tournament championships; and has since competed in the Hockey East Association, winning seven tournament titles. 

Men’s ice hockey is the most popular sport at Boston University and has a large fan base on campus and among BU alumni nationwide.

GO BU!

60% cotton/40% poly = supersoft/vintage feel

name: Bo Knows Rearview
description:
"Bo Knows" was an advertising campaign for Nike cross-training shoes that ran in 1989 and 1990 and featured professional baseball and American football player Bo Jackson.

Jackson was the first athlete in the modern era to play professional baseball and football in the same year. He was the perfect spokesman for a shoe geared toward an athlete actively engaged in more than one sport at a time or with little time between activities to switch to sport-specific footwear.

Bo knows baseball. Bo knows football. Bo Knows Rearview!

Supersoft blend of 50% cotton/50% polyester

name: Figawi
description:
The Figawi is an annual charity event and regatta from Hyannis to Nantucket on the Memorial Day weekend hosted by Figawi, Inc. 

Orginated in 1972 by friends Bob Luby, Joe Horan, and Bob Horan, it quickly organized into an annual event. Now it's the unofficial kick-off of summer on Nantucket island and one hell of a party!

The name "Figawi" is a play on the phrase "Where the f*ck are we?" which the wife or girlfriend of one of the race's founders allegedly uttered during the original race. I'm no expert, but I'd venture to say she was from Boston!

Check your rearview.

Tee is 50% cotton 25% poly 25% rayon - supremely soft!
